results.title: Astronomy: an Open Learning unit
results.creator_credit: Michael Hollander, ABC-TV (Australia), Monash University and Open University
results.brief_description: This astronomy series features the southern skies particularly the work being done in Australia by scientists and astronomers who are trying to unravel the secrets of the universe. These programs are part of an Open Learning unit and can be viewed in conjunction with the series entitled “Universe: the infinite frontier.”

results.title: Astonish me: Graeme Murphy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Creative Spirits Series”.
An examination of Australia’s leading choreographer and founder of the internationally acclaimed Sydney Dance Company. In exploring the background to his creativity, Graeme returns to Mathinna, Tasmania for the first time in thirty years. There he talks about his childhood adventures, his inspiration for dance and his early days at the Australian Ballet.

results.title: Asterix and Cleopatra
results.creator_credit: Pino Van Lamsweerde, Yannik Piel, Dargaud Films and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Thanks to the magic potion made by a Druid, Asterix the tiny Gaul has mighty powers. With his pal Obelix they make life miserable for the Roman soldiers unlucky enough to live near their village. This adventure finds our heroes in Egypt. The Egyptians are famous for their pyramids, but this doesn’t impress the Romans when every other building in Egypt is in danger of falling down. So when Cleopatra, Queen of Egypt, has a blazing row with Julius Caesar, the Roman Emperor, it’s the start of an amazingly funny adventure for Asterix. His task is to build a palace fit for a queen in only a few weeks and win Cleopatra’s bet! Based on the popular books by Goscinny and Underzo.

results.title: Astacus (the crayfish)
results.brief_description: The crayfish is examined as an example of an animal having an external skeleton; the function and structure of each individual part of the skeleton is studied. Detailed consideration is given to the male and female reproductive organs, the arterial system, the nervous system, and the process of feeding and digestion.

results.title: Association Football. Pt. 3. Coaching in the game
results.creator_credit: George Sturt, Football Association and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Instructional film looking at the skills involved in the game of football (soccer). Looks specifically at field positions and strategies of attack and defence. Commentary by Raymond Glendenning.

results.title: Association football. Pt. 2. Trapping
results.creator_credit: George Sturt, Football Association and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Instructional film looking at the skills involved in the game of football (soccer). Demonstrates trapping skills with cushioning, inside and outside of the foot traps, sole and instep traps and trapping on the run. Commentary by Raymond Glendenning.

results.title: Association Football. Pt. 1. Methods of coaching
results.creator_credit: George Sturt, Edward Grossman, Football Association and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Instructional film looking at the skills involved in the game of football (soccer). Shows football players involved in a range of drills including ball control, striking, passing etc. Also includes footage of England vs Wales (c1940s). Commentary by Raymond Glendenning.

results.title: Assignment India
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description: India as a land of young, exciting ideas on democracy, outgrowing its ancient patterns of caste and custom. How programs in agriculture, industry and education are geared to raise the nation’s standard of living. The reasons for the present views of Indian people, their changing attitudes and their hopes for the future. The US Ambassador to India, Mr Chester Bowles, is seen talking to the Indian Prime Minister, Mr Nehru, and discussing the village development program with a young government worker; the economic race between democratic India and Communist China; the legacy of Ghandi; and concludes with three men active in Indian government and public affairs giving their views on India’s problems and reaffirming their faith in democratic methods for their solution.
